Title:
First report of Pseudoveronaea ellipsoidea causing sooty
blotch and flyspeck in China
Abstract:
Pseudoveronaea ellipsoidea is reported and described as a
newly recorded species from China. This fungus was isolated from peels
of hawthorns and apples collected from Shaanxi and Shanxi Provinces, and
displayed sooty blotch and flyspeck signs on hosts. Based on
morphological characteristics and phylogenetic analysis, we identified
our isolates as P. ellipsoidea. It is also the first report of
Pseudoveronaea in China.
